intro: [WRONG START] Cestrum aurantiicuim var. macrocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its showy, tubular, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant produces small, red berries that contain the seeds, which are dispersed by birds. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and fragrant blooms.
